io.requery.sql

Class EntityDataStore<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.requery.sql.EntityDataStore<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - base class or interface to restrict all entities that are stored to (e.g. Object or Serializable for instance.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BlockingEntityStore<T>, EntityStore<T,Object>, Queryable<T>, Transactionable<Object>, AutoCloseable

    public class EntityDataStore<T>
extends Object
implements BlockingEntityStore<T>
    Implementation of BlockingEntityStore that persists and makes queryable Entity instances through standard JDBC database connections.

      • findByKey

        public <E extends T,K> E findByKey(Class<E> type,
                                   K key)
        Description copied from interface: EntityStore
        Find an entity by the given key. This differs from selecting the key using a query in that the EntityCache if available may be checked first for the object. If an entity is found in the cache it will be returned and potentially no query will be made.
        Specified by:
        findByKey in interface BlockingEntityStore<T>
        Specified by:
        findByKey in interface EntityStore<T,Object>
        Type Parameters:
        E - entity type
        K - key type
        Parameters:
        type - non null entity class type
        key - non null key value
        Returns:
        an operation returning the entity if found.

      • update

        public Update<Scalar<Integer>> update()
        Description copied from interface: Queryable
        Initiates an update query against this data store. After completing the expression call Return.get() to perform the operation. The result is the number of rows affected by the call. Note that aggregate update queries will not affect existing entity objects in memory.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Queryable<T>
        Returns:
        next query step

        public <V> V runInTransaction(Callable<V> callable,
                              TransactionIsolation isolation)
        Description copied from interface: Transactionable
        Runs the given callable in a transaction. The transaction will be automatically committed after successful completion of the callable. If the callable throws an exception the transaction will be rolled back.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Specified by:
        toBlocking in interface EntityStore<T,Object>
